page.title: 04WEETING VILLAGE 3
page.content: The only church is C of E and built of flint with a round tower in typical Norfolk style but is mostly Victorian. Close by are the ruins of Weeting Castle in its square moat. It is note- worthy for its icehouse in a mound in the N.W. corner. Another local historic site is Pepper Hill, a round tumulus alongside the bit of Drove Road known as Pepper Lane.Adjacent to this the fields are unusually dipped and according to local people this was the area for digging clay for brickmaking at the start of this century. In the village opposite the green is an attractive row of thatched cottages which are reputed to be the oldest inhabited in the country.
